title: Django4.0 has been released, so try it properly
body:
[Release Notes] (https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/releases

### Dependent library
-Django 3.2
`` `
ASGIREF == 3.4.1
pytz == 2021.3
sqlparse == 0.4.2
`` `
-Django4.0
`` `
ASGIREF == 3.4.1
backports.zoneinfo == 0.2.1
sqlparse == 0.4.2
`` `
You will not be dependent on Pytz and will be changed to a standard Zoneinfo module.
`backports.zoneinfo` is dependent on supporting 3.9 or more.

[backports.zoneinfo] (https://pypi.org/project/backports.zoneinfo/)

### UNIQUECONSTRAINT EXPRESSION

When setting UniqueConstraint, you can now set the index by specifying `Desc ()`, `ASC ()`.

`` `python
Class TestModel (Models.model):
    Code_1 = Models.charfield (max_length = 32)
    Code_2 = Models.charfield (max_length = 32)

    Class Meta:
        constraints = [
            UNIQUECONSTRAINT (
                LOWER ('code_1'),
                LOWER ('code_2'). Desc (),
                Name = 'code_1_2_unique',
            ),
        ]
`` `

SQL issued
`` `SQL
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX "CODE_1_2_UNIQUE" ON "COMMON_TESTMODEL" ((Lower ("code_1"))), (Lower ("code_2") Desc);
`` `


### QuerySet.contains
You can check if the corresponding model exists in QuerySet.

`` `python
Testmodel.objects.contains (Testmodel (ID = 1))
`` `
`` `SQL
Select (1) as "a"
  From "Common_testmodel"
 Where "common_testmodel". "ID" = 1
 Limit 1
`` `

The executed queries do not seem to be the same as EXISTS (). (If this kind of processing)


Continue next time

The source code created this time is [Click here] (https://github.com/kemu3007/django_4_0)
